title: (x) Beautiful script in Suitcase Type Foundry Open Type Collection Catalogue - BistroScript {Yves}
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090830043419im_/http:/typophile.com/files/script_3511.jpg)

Does anyone recognize this wonderful script? This image was taken from the _Suitcase Type Foundry Open Type Collection Catalogue_ designed by Tomáš Brousil. Unfortunately, [Suitcase](http://web.archive.org/web/20090830043419/http:/www.suitcasetype.com/ "Suitcase Type Foundry") doesn’t seem to offer the script on their website—at least not currently. If it helps, I found the image [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20090830043419/http:/www.typosemestr.cz/suitcase-type-foundry-open-type-collection-catalogue).

Thanks in advance,  
Ken
author: kensoliva

comments.content:
This is BistroScript, _“(...) a contemporary calligraphic script inspired by promotional art in the 1960s. Thanks to OpenType features, a variety of ligatures and alternative glyphs allow the user to create more authentic and varied connections between letters. Used thoughtfully, BistroScript is guaranteed to enhance any print job.”_

I know, I helped Tomas with the English text for his catalogue. This is from my version of the text document that’s still on my hard drive. ;^)
Thanks Yves! Any idea where I can see more of it and perhaps buy?
I’ll ask Tomas when he’s planning to release it.
I look forward to Tomas’ answer…

Hi Yves, hi Ken,

I’ll update my website just after two weeks holiday, I promise. And BistroScript will not the only one new font.)

Tomas

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090830043419im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture_1_6459.gif)

Thanks for posting the additional type specimens. As the son of a second generation sign painter, I must declare that you have successfully captured an era with this script! I can’t wait to learn more about the OpenType features of BistroScript and see what other font(s) you have up your sleeves.

Thomas,

Will you contact me please. I would like to talk to you about this face. You can reach me at kyle [at] brandsbyovo [dot] com.

Thanks!
Welcome to Typophile, Tomas! Looking forward to the new Suitcase releases.
That @s ligature is absolutely wonderful. Simples, ingenius; I’d buy the font just for that (and for the rest too, of course!) Congratulations!

Hi everyone,

new typefaces BistroScript, Corpulent, Gloriola and Purista, are officially published at [http://www.suitcasetype.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20090830043419/http:/www.suitcasetype.com/ "http://www.suitcasetype.com").

Tomas

Great stuff, Tomas!  
I especially dig the thin/hair weights of Gloriola and Purista. Niiice, děkuij!
Corpulent cleverly caters to the recent trend of bloated constructed geometric types.
My remark was meant as a compliment! :^D I like it!
This font is peaking to me on multiple levels, Unfortunately, my wallet is deaf.
